name: trembled
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
tremble
B2 to shake slightly in a way that you cannot control, for example because you are frightened, angry, or excited, or because of illness: I was trembling with fear, panicking that I had not made the right decision. At her side Michael trembled uncontrollably. He was so distraught he could not speak. I could see them coming for me. I was already trembling in anticipation when they grabbed me. Her bottom lip trembled, and tears welled up in her eyes. His voice started to tremble, and I thought he was going to cry.
of the ground or an object, to shake slightly: The pair remained calm as the earth trembled beneath their feet. I could tell the wind was rising - the leaves were trembling on the trees. Synonyms
shake (MOVE)
shiver
vibrate
More examplesFewer examplesI was trembling as I entered the room.I felt dizzy and my legs were trembling.His voice trembled with emotion as he gave his speech.He was thrown down as the ground trembled.
